next atrocity. We should stop Trump’s cycle of attack & distract. The media can help by discarding the moral equivalency that makes their reporting ineffective. Why lend aid & comfort by presenting immoral words and deeds as if they were just another side of an equal debate?

Maybe with China who had “failed” to succumb to Trump’s trade war or violated some dictate in the South China Sea. Regardless, the media will allow for the next distraction. Americans will be so weary of all the drama (many already are), they won’t protest or mobilize against the

A moment that the news media will allow the nation to become distracted from by the next scene in the Trump/GOP sh_t show. In order to command attention they will up the stakes, perhaps with a contrived conflict or war, maybe with Mexico who has “failed” to control the border...

Then the next time the media zooms their lens on the camps, it will be because some atrocity has occurred. Maybe HHS will force sterilization of pubescent teens, maybe some will be sexually abused or trafficked, maybe some will be killed. Regardless, it will be a moment of horror

While the media will cover the new detainees for a while, Trump will successfully distract them and will use the intermission to grow the number of incarcerated migrants, including children. Maybe there will be another caravan or two just in time for some crucial election or vote

Next, they will have military with live ammunition confront the migrants at the border. There will be gunfire, maybe bloodshed. They will lock up the migrants and add to the migrant detention camps. This will be a win win for the private prison industry, a big Republican client.

I suspected that Trump was going to use the approaching migrant caravan to militarize the border, and now he’s confirmed it. Last night he said: “Wait ‘til you see what we’re doing with our border over the next few weeks.” He’s scripting a show. Next scene https://t.co/vc9lnXDCgz

RT @ParisBienert: The Chair and 1st Vice Chair of the Maryland Democratic Party @mddems will now both be from Baltimore City - @MayaRockeym…
I look forward to collaborating with all stakeholders to strengthen our party and to make it a model for the nation.

The full body also selected an inspiring cabinet of officers with the experience and abilities to drive home our Go DEEP Agenda. The road ahead will not be an easy task but it is a task worth doing to protect and expand the well being of Maryland families.
I thank the former chair, Kathleen Matthews, for her service and friendship and look forward to working with her during this transition period and beyond.
And the full body gave me their vote of confidence with an overwhelming majority confirming me as chair of the state party.
My nominators, Maureen Evans Arthurs, Sheila Ruth, and Ben Smith were simply terrific in making the case for my candidacy. The volunteer whips in the various counties were effective and efficient.
